Entries.default: "Is this your first time to the baths?" An old man stretches his arms over his head and yawns, making a show of displaying his moistened physique.
"I haven't been in the water yet."
"I've bathed here before."
[Leave] "I should go. Right now."
"Looks like someone needs a nap."
"Ah. The cost is high, but so are the delights."
"And how could you have escaped my eye?" He bites his thumbnail and grins.

"I might have the skin and bones of a retired scarecrow, but the waters bring youth back... where it counts." 

He studies you from under a lowered brow as his knees begin to drift apart.

"A bed, perhaps. But there will be no sleep for me."

He spreads his lips in a knowing grin.
"Go on."
"Nope. You can stop that right now."
"You genuinely believe I needed to hear and see this?"
"Excuse me?" He pauses and blinks at you, a rivulet of sweat working down the bridge of his nose.
"Go admit to the steward you're treating this establishment like a brothel."
"Just keep it to yourself, grandpa."
He hangs his head and winces as onlookers begin to slyly observe your exchange.

"I... I'm sorry. That was wrong. The waters have gone to my head."

He swallows and glances toward the steward, the color leaving his face as he summons his courage.
The old man winces, his eyes downcast.
"No matter. I won't let this energy go to waste." He furrows his brow and glances toward the other patrons.
"If only we had a bit of privacy. Maybe in another life, eh?" He winks, sighing to himself and catching his breath.
"You'll excuse me."
"Couldn't stay away, could you?"
"No! My eyes!"
